content: Which was built first: the Great Wall of China or the Colosseum?

The Great Wall of China and the Colosseum are both monumental structures with rich histories, but they were built in different time periods and for different purposes.

The Great Wall of China is not a single, continuous wall but a series of fortifications built over centuries to protect the northern borders of Chinese states and empires. The earliest sections of the wall date back to the 7th century BC during the reign of the Zhou dynasty. However, the most well-known and best-preserved parts of the wall were constructed during the Ming dynasty (1368–1644 AD). So, the initial construction of the Great Wall predates the Colosseum by many centuries.

On the other hand, the Colosseum, also known as the Flavian Amphitheatre, is located in Rome, Italy. It was built between 70-80 AD under the rule of Emperor Vespasian and his son Titus. The Colosseum was used for gladiatorial contests, public spectacles, and other events.

Therefore, the Great Wall of China was built first, with its earliest sections predating the Colosseum by over a millennium.
